sen.e: Norimune was a name of a sword craftsman of Bizen Province, the origin of the Fukuoka Ichimonji style and a generic name for all the Japanese swords produced by Norimune.

sen.j: 後鳥羽上皇は諸国の名刀工を招いて鍛えさせ、親しく焼刃をしたと伝える。
sen.e: The retired Emperor Gotoba invited noted sward craftsmen from various provinces to train and he burnt blades with them casually.
sen.cmt: 「親しく焼刃をした」のは後鳥羽上皇と解釈しました。
sen.e: The retired Emperor Gotoba invited noted sward craftsmen from various provinces, had them forge swords, and casually tempered the swords with them.
sen.cmt: 「鍛えさせ」は「刀を鍛える」の意味だと思いますので、train → have them forge swords と変更しました。また、burnt blades → tempered the swords と変更しました。「親しく焼刃した」の主語は後鳥羽上皇で間違いないと思います。

sen.j: 則宗は御番鍛冶を務めた事から、後鳥羽上皇が定めた皇位の紋である16弁のキク紋を銘に入れることを許された。
sen.e: Because Norimune was working as a swordsmith in attendance, he was allowed to inscribe a 16-petal chrysanthemum, the crest that the retired Emperor of Gotoba chose to show his Imperial Throne.
